revised_title: Magnetic Forces Acting on a Needle: Experiments in Paris and London
tldr: Edward Sabine conducted experiments to determine the ratio of magnetic forces acting on a horizontally suspended needle in Paris and London. The results showed that the horizontal directive force in Paris was greater than in London, with a ratio of 1068:1000. Additionally, the intensity of the directive force on the dipping needle was found to be greater in London than in Paris by about 15 parts in 1000.
